intro: Arytera densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered arnica, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Arytera densiflora is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
